resources.string: Key Mapper needs to use an accessibility service so it can listen to button/key presses and perform the actions you\'ve chosen. The accessibility service only listens for key events and detects which app you are in. You can look at the source code, which is linked in the About screen, to verify this.

When you click \"record trigger\", you have 5 seconds to press the keys/buttons which will trigger the action. Your trigger will be added after the 5 seconds. Press \"clear\" to clear the keys you have already typed. If a button isn\'t detected here, the device vendor is probably blocking accessibility services from seeing it. Therefore, it can\'t be remapped.
The app will work but some things might need fixing depending on what you\'re doing.
Your device doesn\'t support some actions.
The name for this device isn\'t known
Key Mapper is performing an action…
Screenshot resolution doesn\'t match this device\'s resolution!

IMPORTANT!!! These coordinates are only correct when your display is in the same orientation as the screenshot! This action will cancel any touches or gestures you are doing on the screen.\n\nIf you need help finding the coordinates of a point on your screen take a screenshot and then tap on the screenshot where you want this action to press.
perform Key Mapper actions that require a keyboard
Get the new Key Mapper Keyboard that actually has a keyboard!
Click the key on the device which you want to be entered. \n\nIMPORTANT! Inputting this key as an action will only work if you are using a Key Mapper compatible keyboard.
IMPORTANT! Inputting this keycode as an action will only work if you are using a Key Mapper compatible keyboard.
Type some text you want to be inserted when you perform this action.
Type a url which you want to be opened. The http://, https:// or www. isn\'t required.
Can\'t find any paired devices. Is Bluetooth turned on?
Exception in onKeyEvent. Look in logcat.
Once you have enabled the device admin, you must DEACTIVATE it if you want to uninstall the app.
Long Press Volume Down • USB Keyboard

Does the help page solve your problem? What is your device?

 Which OEM skin or ROM are you using?

 Please describe the issue you're having:
This is the input method built-in to Key Mapper. It has *NO* interface. Therefore, if you have a password screen lock you will *NOT* be able to unlock your phone.
An AOSP keyboard forked from the OpenBoard project by @dslul. This is the recommended Key Mapper compatible keyboard with a GUI.
Can\'t find the Accessibility settings page
Are you sure you want to leave without saving?
Make sure Bluetooth is turned on and you have paired devices. Then try again.

When you tap \"OK\", you will be taken to Settings. In the Settings, scroll to the bottom and tap "Enable Root Features" so you can use root features/actions. If you know your phone isn\'t rooted or you don\'t know what root is, you can\'t use features which only work on rooted devices.
Can you please describe the issue you are having in the email, otherwise I can\'t help you. Thanks!
Long pressing only works for physical volume and navigation buttons. If you enable it for other keys, the keys won\'t work when they aren\'t long pressed.

To grant Key Mapper WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission, enable "root features" in the settings if your device is rooted. If your device isn\'t rooted, go to the Help page and follow the guide on how to use a PC/Mac to grant permission.

To grant Key Mapper WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission, enable "root features" in the settings if your device is rooted. If your device isn\'t rooted, go to the Help page and follow the guide on how to use a PC/Mac to grant permission.

Your device doesn\'t seem to have an accessibility services settings page. You can enable the accessibility service by giving the app WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission. After you tap \'okay\' a popup will guide you how to do it.
"Multiple keys can't be double pressed at the same time."
The keys need to be listed from top to bottom in the order that they will be held down.

A \"sequence\" trigger has a timeout unlike parallel triggers. This means after you press the first key, you will have a set amount of time to input the rest of the keys in the trigger. All the keys that you have added to the trigger won\'t do their usual action until the timeout has been reached. You can change this timeout in the "Options" tab.

Please check out the Help page to see if your question has already been answered. If not, then the developer would prefer it if you ask for help and suggest features in the Discord server. If you don\'t have Discord, you can email the developer directly.

Android doesn\'t allow apps to get a list of connected (not paired) Bluetooth devices. Apps can only detect when they are connected and disconnected. So if your Bluetooth device is already connected to your device when the accessibility service starts, you will have to reconnect it for the app to know it is connected.
Change location or turn off automatic backup?

Screen on/off constraints will only work if you have turned on the \"detect trigger when screen is off\" keymap option. This option will only show for some keys (e.g volume buttons) and if you are rooted. See a list of supported keys on the Help page.

If you have any other screen lock chosen, such as PIN or Pattern then you don\'t have to worry. But if you have a Password screen lock you will *NOT* be able to unlock your phone if you use the Key Mapper keyboard because it doesn\'t have a GUI yet. You can grant Key Mapper WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission so it can show a notification to switch to and from the keyboard. There is a guide on how to do this if you tap the question mark at the bottom of the screen.
Select the input method for actions that require one. You can change this later by tapping \"Select Keyboard For Actions\" in the bottom menu of the homescreen.

You need to choose the \"Caps Lock to Camera\" keyboard layout for your keyboard otherwise the Caps Lock key will still caps lock. You can find this setting in your device settings -> Languages and Input -> Physical Keyboard -> Tap on your keyboard -> Set Up Keyboard Layouts. This will remap the Caps Lock key to KEYCODE_CAMERA so Key Mapper can remap it properly.\n\nAfter you\'ve done this you must remove the Caps Lock trigger key and record the Caps Lock key again. It should say \"Camera\" instead of \"Caps Lock\" if you did the steps correctly.
Where do you want to get the app?
Tap to start the accessibility service.
Tap to start showing the keyboard again.
Tap to switch to and from the Key Mapper keyboard.
Tap to enable the Key Mapper keyboard.
How long a button should be pressed for it to be detected as a long press. Default is 500ms. Can be overridden in a keymap\'s options.
How fast does a button have to be double pressed for it to be detected as a double press. Default is 300ms. Can be overridden in a keymap\'s options.
How long to vibrate if vibrating is enabled for a keymap. Default is 200ms. Can be overridden in a keymap\'s options.
How long a key map needs to be held down for the action to start repeating. Default is 400ms. Can be overridden in a keymap\'s options.
The delay between every time an action is repeated. Default is 50ms. Can be overridden in a keymap\'s options.
The time allowed to complete a sequence trigger. Default is 1000ms. Can be overridden in a keymap\'s options.
Show a persistent notification to allow you to pick a keyboard.
Show a persistent notification which starts/pauses your keymaps and has a link to start/stop the accessibility service.
Automatically backup keymaps to a specified location
When a Bluetooth device you have chosen connects or disconnects, the keyboard picker will show automatically. Choose the devices below.
Show a toast message when you perform an action
A little message will popup when you perform an action.

Enable logging of important events inside the app so it is easier for the developer (or you) to debug any issues you are having with the app. The app will log some potentially sensitive information, such as when and which keys are being pressed so disable this once you have finished logging. The log will never leave your device without your permission and it can\'t be read by another app or you in a text editor. It will disappear if you uninstall the app. A button to see the log will appear in the menu on the home screen. From here you can delete the log and send it to the developer if you need.
Show a message when an error is encountered in the app
A message will be shown on the screen prompting you to log it when the app encounters an error it is aware of.
Automatically change the keyboard on Bluetooth connection

The Key Mapper keyboard will be automatically selected when a chosen bluetooth device is connected. Your old keyboard will be automatically selected when the device disconnects. There may be a 5-10 second delay after disconnecting your device for the keyboard to change.

Enable this if you want to use features/actions which only work on rooted devices. Key Mapper must have root permission from your root-access-management app (e.g Magisk, SuperSU) for these features to work. Only turn this on if you know your device is rooted and you have given Key Mapper root permission.
Switch between the Key Mapper keyboard and your default keyboard when you tap the notification.
Automatically change the keyboard when toggling keymaps
Automatically select the Key Mapper keyboard when you resume your keymaps and select your default keyboard when pausing them.
Hide the alerts at the top of the homescreen.
These options will only work on root devices! If you don\'t know what root is or whether your device is rooted, please don\'t leave a poor review if they don\'t work. :)
These options are only enabled if Key Mapper has WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission. There are instructions to grant it in the Help page.
Show a toast message when performing
Vibrate when keys are initially pressed and again when long-pressed.
Detect trigger when screen is off. ROOT only.
Your keymaps will only work once you have enabled the accessibility service. It also needs to be turned on to create a trigger.
You can only record a trigger if the accessibility service is enabled.

There is no guarantee that every action will work on your device and that every button can be detected. This is because there are many flavours of Android, and OEMs can break features by accident or intentionally. If something doesn\'t work, please notify the developer and refrain from giving the app a poor rating since the issue is often out of the developer\'s control. =)

Tap "Turn off" to prevent Android from stopping the app while it is in the background. Your OEM\'s skin such as MIUI or Samsung Experience may have other \"battery saving\" features so it is recommended to turn them off for Key Mapper as well.
Your device seems to support Samsung Dex

Samsung doesn\'t allow apps with a 3rd party keyboard to open while in Dex mode. Therefore, this app won\'t open and the Key Mapper keyboard won\'t work while you are in Dex mode. Your key maps which don\'t require the Key Mapper keyboard will still work while you\'re in Dex mode.
The app needs Do Not Disturb access if you want actions which change the volume and remapped volume buttons to work.

"This app is open source! You can start contributing by heading over to the sds100/KeyMapper repo on GitHub and by joining the Discord server. Even if you can\'t code, you can contribute by helping others and testing the latest cutting-edge features."
Tap the 3 dots to change the repeat behaviour and more. You can test an action and fix action errors by tapping it.

This option will only work if your device is rooted and you have told Key Mapper that it has root permission in the Key Mapper settings. If you don\'t know what root is then this option will not work. It will also only work for some keys (e.g volume buttons) so see the Help page for a list of supported keys.
Key Mapper accessibility service is disabled
Key Mapper Keyboard service is disabled
You must have at least one trigger
The shortcut must have a title!
You must be using one of the Key Mapper keyboards for this action to work!
Can\'t find the shortcut. Is the app installed or enabled?
The app with package name %s isn\'t installed!
You need to grant Key Mapper permission to modify system settings to use this action.
This is only supported up to Android %s
Can\'t find the keyboard settings page!
Key Mapper needs to be a device administrator to use this action!
Key Mapper doesn\'t have permission to use that shortcut.
The app needs permission to change the Do Not Disturb state!
This action needs permission to read the phone state!
Can\'t find the WRITE_SETTINGS permission page!
No compatible app is found to send feedback.
If you are remapping a volume button you need to give the app Do Not Disturb access if you want the buttons to work while in Do Not Disturb mode!
Permission to change Do Not Disturb mode granted!
Can\'t find the Do Not Disturb access permission settings!
Key Mapper encountered an error! Try to reproduce the error, enable logging to see what happened.
Key Mapper encountered an error! Look in the Log.
No app can be found to open that url
Failed to execute "getevent" command. Are you sure you\'re rooted?
Maximum number of cameras in use!
The accessibility service must be enabled for this app to work!
The accessibility service needs to be enabled!
Your selected input method needs to be enabled for “Key Event”, “Key”, “Text” and some other actions to work.
None of the Key Mapper keyboards are enabled!
A Key Mapper keyboard is enabled!
A Key Mapper keyboard must be enabled and selected for some of your actions to work!
This device has no enabled input methods!
Your keymaps won\'t work! Some things need fixing!
You can\'t move to the end of the text in this field!
Battery optimisation settings not found! If it exists, open it manually.
error: Can\'t find a label for this option \"%s\"
This keymap already has this constraint!
This keymap already has this action!
Can\'t find the Key Mapper input method!
File isn\'t cached! Connect to internet to download it.
File access denied! Is it deleted?
Failed to backup to file. Is it deleted?
Cycle Through Ringer Modes (Ring, Vibrate, Silent)
Not all media apps support fast forwarding. E.g Google Play Music.
Not all media apps support rewinding. E.g Google Play Music.
Go to Last App. (Double Press Recents)

This will lock your device but you will only be able to log back in with your PIN. The fingerprint scanner and face unlock will be disabled. For now this is the only reliable way I have found to lock non-rooted devices before Android Pie 9.0.
You must turn on the option to detect the trigger when the screen is off!
The Key Mapper keyboard must be selected for this action to work and this action may not work as intended in some apps.
This action will only work if you have tapped on an input field where the keyboard is supposed to be shown.
